[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I didn't watch my grandkids today so I checked out a new book to read.
It's nice to have a break. Did you find the book sufficiently exciting? 
Yes, it's a really intense crime drama!  I'm really loving it so far.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Babysitting and Family Time', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A talks about babysitting her grandkids and spending time with them.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: Just woke up from a nap! Finally feeling refreshed; a weekend with the grandkids took it out of me. Think I'm going to go to the library to see if they have any new books.  ### Speaker B: I can imagine how draining that can be.  Even running around my son is so tiring.  How often do you babysit your grandkids? ### Speaker A: About four days of the week. and most weekends. Their parents are very busy and since there are so many I usually have one hanging around somewhere or other.   ### Speaker B: Wow that's impressive. Aren't you tired? I am sure they keep you pretty busy! ### Speaker A: Most of them are old enough to be able to work the TV, computer, or a bicycle. Or we just hang out and watch Jeopardy. The busiest time is the weekend when I cook. Everyone loves to come and raid my fridge.' }
